findings.Lower Thorax: The lung bases are clear. The heart size is normal and there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.
findings.Liver: The liver is normal in contour and signal intensity without focal lesions.
findings.Biliary: Mild dilatation of the left hepatic and right anterior biliary tree is stable. The common bile duct measures up to 1.0 cm, which is unchanged.
findings.Pancreas: The pancreas is normal in size. There is some loss of signal intensity on the T1-weighted images in the uncinate process with persistent enhancement on the delayed phase images and very mildly increased T2 signal.
findings.Spleen: The spleen is normal in size and signal intensity.
findings.Kidneys: Multiple rounded T2 hyperintense lesions in the kidneys bilaterally consistent with simple cysts.
findings.Gastrointestinal Tract: Status post partial gastrectomy with expected postsurgical anatomy. A small hiatal hernia is noted. A large duodenum diverticulum is unchanged.
findings.Vasculature: The arterial anatomy is conventional. There is no aneurysmal dilatation or flow-limiting stenosis of the visualized great vessels of the abdomen.
findings.Osseous and Soft Tissue Structures: Multiple T2 hyperintense lesions within the mid thoracic spine consistent with hemangiomas. No osseous lesions are worrisome for infection or malignancy.

changes_over_time.Biliary: Mild dilatation is stable from a previous unspecified date. The common bile duct measurement is unchanged from a previous unspecified date.
changes_over_time.Gastrointestinal Tract: The large duodenum diverticulum is unchanged from a previous unspecified date.
